ul.li2: “you return to me.
ul.li1: And if you remove your abominations from my presence,Literally “faces”
ul.li2: and you do not wander,
ul.li1: 2and you swear, ‘As Yahweh lives,’Literally “life of Yahweh”
ul.li2: in truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
ul.li1: then nations will be blessed by him,
ul.li2: and in him they will boast.”
ul.li1: 3For thus says Yahweh
ul.li2: to the menHebrew “man” of Judah and to Jerusalem,
ul.li1: “Break up for yourselves prepared virgin soil,
ul.li2: and you must not sow among thornbushes.
ul.li1: 4Circumcise yourselves to Yahweh,
ul.li2: and remove the foreskins of your hearts,Hebrew “heart”
ul.li1: menHebrew “man” of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem,
ul.li2: lest my wrath goes forth like the fire and burns,
ul.li1: and there is no one who extinguishes it,Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation
ul.li2: because of the evil of your deeds.”

ul.li1: 5Declare in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem and say,
ul.li2: “Blow a horn through the land,
ul.li1: call with a loud voiceLiterally “call fill” and say,
ul.li2: ‘Be gathered and let us go into the fortified cities.’
ul.li1: 6Lift up a signal toward Zion,
ul.li2: bring yourselves to safety; you must not remain standing,
ul.li1: for I am bringing evil from the north,
ul.li2: and a great destruction.
ul.li1: 7A lion has gone up from his thicket,
ul.li2: and a destroyer of nations has set out.
ul.li1: He has gone out from his place to make your land as a horror,
ul.li2: your cities will go to ruin withoutLiterally “from not” inhabitant.
ul.li1: 8Because of this gird yourselves with sackcloth,Hebrew “sackcloths” lament and wail,
ul.li2: for the burning angerLiterally “the blaze of the nose” of Yahweh has not turned back from us.
ul.li1: 9And then on that day,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
“the heart of the king and the heart of the officials will be destroyed,
ul.li2: and the priests will be appalled,
and the prophets will be astonished.”

chapter.p: 10Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh, surely you have utterly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘It will be peace for you,’ while the sword reaches up to the throat.”

ul.li1: 11At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem,
ul.li2: “A hot wind from the barren heightsLiterally “a wind of shimmering of barren heights” in the desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li1: in the direction ofLiterally “the way of” the daughter of my people,
ul.li2: not to winnow and not to cleanse,
ul.li1: 12a wind too strong forLiterally “a wind strong more than” these will come for me,
ul.li2: now also I speak judgments against them.”
ul.li1: 13Look, he comes up like the clouds,
ul.li2: and his chariots are like the whirlwind,
ul.li1: his horses are swifter than eagles,
ul.li2: woe to us, for we are devastated.
ul.li1: 14Cleanse your heart from wickedness, O Jerusalem,
ul.li2: so that you may be saved.
ul.li1: How longLiterally “until when” will your thoughts of mischief
ul.li2: dwell in your inner part?
ul.li1: 15For a voice is declaring from Dan,
ul.li2: and is proclaiming disaster from the mountain of Ephraim.
ul.li1: 16“Report to the nations, ‘Here they are!’
ul.li2: Proclaim against Jerusalem,
ul.li1: ‘Besiegers are coming from a distant land,Literally “from a land the distance place”
ul.li2: and they raise their voice against the cities of Judah.’
ul.li1: 17Like watchers of a field they were against her from all around,
ul.li2: because she has rebelled against me,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 18“You obtained this for yourself
ul.li2: because of your way and your deeds.
ul.li1: This is your doom, for it is bitter,
ul.li2: yes, it has reached up to your heart.”
ul.li1: 19My bowels, my bowels! I writhe!
ul.li2: The walls of my heart!
ul.li1: My heart is restless within me, I cannot keep silent,
ul.li2: for I hear in my inner self the sound of a horn, the alarm of war.
ul.li1: 20Destruction on destruction is proclaimed,
ul.li2: for all of the land is devastated.
ul.li1: Suddenly my tents are devastated,
ul.li2: my tent curtains in a moment.
ul.li1: 21How long must I see the banner,
ul.li2: and hear the sound of a horn?
ul.li1: 22“For my people are foolish,
ul.li2: they have not known me.
ul.li1: They are foolish children,
ul.li2: and they do not have insight.
ul.li1: They are skillful at doing evil,
ul.li2: and they do not know how to do good.”
ul.li1: 23I looked at the earth, and behold, it was wasteland and emptiness,
ul.li2: and to the heavens, and they were without their light.
ul.li1: 24I looked at the mountains, and behold, they were quaking,
ul.li2: and all of the hills were jolted to and fro.
ul.li1: 25I looked and behold, there was no person,
ul.li2: and all of the birdsHebrew “bird” of the sky had fled.
ul.li1: 26I looked and behold, the fruitful land was a desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li2: and all of its cities were ruined before Yahweh,
before the face of his burning anger.Literally “the blaze of his nose”
ul.li1: 27For thus says Yahweh, “All of the land will be a desolation,
ul.li2: yet I will not make a complete desolation.
ul.li1: 28Because of this the earth will mourn,
ul.li2: and the heavens above will become dark.
ul.li1: Because I have spoken, I have planned,
ul.li2: and I have not relented, and I will not turn back from it.”
ul.li1: 29From the sound of a horseman and an archerLiterally “one who shoots arrows of a bow” every town flees,
ul.li2: they enter in the thickets and among the rocks they climb.
ul.li1: Every town is forsaken,
ul.li2: and there is no person who lives in them.
ul.li1: 30And you, O devastated one, what do you do,
ul.li2: that you put on crimson,
ul.li1: that you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold,
ul.li2: that you make your eyes look bigger with the eye make-up?
ul.li1: In vain you beautify yourself.
ul.li2: Your lovers reject you;
they seek your life.
ul.li1: 31For I heard a voice like an ill woman,
ul.li2: anxiety like a woman who bears her first child,
ul.li1: the voice of the daughter of Zion.
ul.li2: She is gasping for breath,
she is spreading out her hands:
